sentences: Paul Van Haver (Dutch pronunciation: [ˈpɔu̯l vɑn ˈɦɑvər]; born 12 March 1985), better known by his stage name Stromae (French pronunciation: ​[stʁomaj]), is a Belgian singer-songwriter, rapper and musician.
Stromae came to wide public attention in 2009 with his song "Alors on danse" (from the album Cheese), which became a number one in several European countries.
In 2013, his second album Racine carrée was a commercial success, selling 2 million copies in France alone and nearly 600,000 units elsewhere.
He and his siblings were raised by their mother, as his father, a prominent architect, was killed during the 1994 Rwandan genocide, while visiting his family.
2000–07: Early career =
In 2000, he appeared as a rapper called Opmaestro, though he later changed his stage name to "Stromae", which is "Maestro" with the syllables reversed following the French slang practice, verlan.

section: == Career == | === 2007–08: Debut EP and record career ===

sentences: In 2007, during his studies at the film school of Brussels, Stromae decided to concentrate fully on his musical career.
section: == Career == | === 2007–08: Debut EP and record career ===

sentences: In 2008 he signed a 4-year record deal with "Because Music" and 'Kilomaître'.
section: == Career == | === 2007–08: Debut EP and record career ===

sentences: 2008–2012: Breakthrough and international success =
In 2008, Stromae worked as a young trainee at the music radio station NRJ in Brussels.
By May 2010 the track "Alors on danse" had reached number one in Belgium, France, Sweden, Greece, Germany, Austria, Turkey, Switzerland, Italy, Denmark, Romania, and the Czech Republic.
In 2010, he was nominated for Best Dutch and Belgian Act at the MTV Europe Music Awards.
He is one of the ten winners of the European Border Breakers Award 2011.
On 9 February 2011, his debut album Cheese (including the hit single "Alors on danse") won the award for Best Dance Album at the Victoires de la musique.
On 23 May 2011, during the recording of the French TV show Taratata, Stromae did a mashup of "Alors on danse" and "Don't Stop the Party" with the Black Eyed Peas.
In 2011, he received one nomination for Best Belgian Act at the MTV Europe Music Awards.
The first single "Papaoutai" from his second album Racine carrée (English: Square root) was digitally released on 13 May 2013.
On 22 May 2013, amateur-looking videos appeared on YouTube showing Stromae, apparently drunk and wandering at the Louiza tram station in Brussels at dawn.
On 26 July 2013, Stromae announced on his Facebook and Twitter accounts that he had completed his second studio album Racine carrée or √ and that it would be released on 16 August 2013.
On 26 July 2013, Stromae announced on his Facebook and Twitter accounts that he had completed his second studio album Racine carrée or √ and that it would be released on 16 August 2013.
On 25 August 2013, Stromae joined Major Lazer's show at French festival Rock en Seine, where he performed "Papaoutai".
In September 2013, Belgian rock band Mintzkov covered his song "Formidable" for a live session on Studio Brussel, with lyrics in English.
In November 2013, Stromae received the award for Best Belgian Act at the MTV Europe Music Awards.
On 22 February 2014, he performed his song "Formidable" as a guest at the Sanremo Music Festival in Italy.
On 17 March 2014, it was made public that Stromae's song "Ta fête" would become the official song for the Belgian national football team at the 2014 FIFA World Cup.
On 17 March 2014, it was made public that Stromae's song "Ta fête" would become the official song for the Belgian national football team at the 2014 FIFA World Cup.
In June 2014, in support of Racine carrée, Stromae made his US television debut on NBC's Late Night with Seth Meyers.
While in New York, on 22 June 2014, Stromae guest starred in a Snapchat story with Jérôme Jarre as The Carrot's Father.

On 21 October 2014, it was revealed that New Zealand singer Lorde invited Stromae to work on the soundtrack for The Hunger Games: Mockingjay – Part 1 along with artists like Kanye West, Grace Jones, Diplo and The Chemical Brothers.
In March 2015, Stromae released a music video for the song "Carmen", which was directed by Sylvain Chomet.
Stromae continued touring the United States, performing in March 2015 in several places including the SXSW in Austin, Texas.
On 14 September 2015, Stromae released a single "Quand c'est?", a song about cancer, which plays on the fact that "Quand c'est?"
2018–present: New work & Multitude =
On 6 April 2018, Stromae released his first new single in more than three years, "Défiler", to accompany the release of "Capsule 5" a new fashion line.
In 2019, he co-produced and provided vocals, in French, for the song "Arabesque" of the band Coldplay, for their album Everyday Life.
On November 10, 2020, during his first Live Instagram on the occasion of Mosaert's 10th anniversary, he mentioned working on new music.
Finally, on October 15, 2021 his first single in 3 years, named "Santé", was released.
On December 8, 2021, he announced that his long awaited third studio album "Multitude" will be released on March 4, 2022.
On December 8, 2021, he announced that his long awaited third studio album "Multitude" will be released on March 4, 2022.
On January 9, 2022, he unveiled a second single from the album, "L'enfer", by performing it live during the 8pm TV news on TF1.
In 2009, Stromae collaborated with Kery James on the song “Ghetto”, also featuring J-mi Sissoko.
In 2010, Stromae's song "Alors on danse" was remixed by Kanye West.
West and Stromae also performed the remix live at Coachella in 2015.
Stromae collaborated with Lorde, Haim, Pusha T, and Q-Tip for the song "Meltdown", which uses the instrumental of his song "Merci", a track originally recorded for his 2014 album Racine carrée.
The video was released on 12 January 2018.
Stromae provided vocals for Coldplay's 2019 single “Arabesque" on their eighth studio album Everyday Life.
The second collection, Capsule No. 2, was released at Colette in Paris on 3 December 2014, and features the square root design on each item in different colors.
Capsule No. 3 was released on 7 April 2016, a music track was released on 31 March 2017 to promote the line.
Capsule No. 3 was released on 7 April 2016, a music track was released on 31 March 2017 to promote the line.

On 6 April 2018, Mosaert presented a fashion show at Le Bon Marché Rive Gauche in Paris to mark the release of its latest collection, "Capsule n°5", which was accompanied by the release of Stromae's first new single in more than five years, "Défiler".
In 2015 he had to cancel a tour through Africa because of anxiety caused by the malaria medicine Lariam (Mefloquine).
In an interview in 2017, he stated that he still suffers from panic attacks and initially left open whether he would ever be able to make music professionally again.
Since 2018 he has been showing himself in public again.
On 12 December 2015, Van Haver was secretly married to Coralie Barbier by well-known Catholic priest Guy Gilbert, in a private ceremony held in Mechelen.
His first son was born on 23 September 2018.

On 2 September, Stromae collaborated with Kanye West and Gilbere Forte in a remix of his hit "Alors on danse".
In a few weeks from that point, sales of the song established it as number one in Belgium.
Stromae also announced he would perform as the opening support act for the first of two concerts by the band in Paris on 24 and 25 June 2011 at Stade De France.
Stromae had previously met will.i.am at the NRJ Music Awards in January.
On 22 May 2013, amateur-looking videos appeared on YouTube showing Stromae, apparently drunk and wandering at the Louiza tram station in Brussels at dawn.
A few days later, it was revealed that this was linked with the filming of a professional music video.
The music video was made from edited hidden-camera footage taken on 22 May.

He then began a tour in Africa on 13 May.
However, in mid-June Stromae was forced to cancel the remaining of his shows until 2 August for health reasons.
He performed at Madison Square Garden in October, becoming the first exclusively French-singing performer to sell out that venue.
By the end of 2015, the album became the first in over a decade to reach 2 million sales in France.

The first collection was a success, with stocks almost sold out after three days.
The new designs are the first to use patterns not previously worn by Stromae, reflecting Mosaert's intention to gradually move into a separate stylistic identity for the clothing line.
